Name: Suspending alternate side parking regulations on Tisha B’Av.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to suspending alternate side parking regulations on Tisha B’Av

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Summary: This bill would suspend alternate side parking regulations on Tisha B’Av.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      Section 1. Subdivision a of section 19-163 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 5 for the year 2019, is amended to read as follows:
      a. All alternate side of the street parking rules shall be suspended on the following holidays: Christmas, Yom Kippur, Rosh Hashanah, Ash Wednesday, Holy Thursday, Good Friday, Ascension Thursday, Feast of the Assumption, Feast of All Saints, Feast of the Immaculate Conception, first two days of Succoth, Shemini Atzareth, Simchas Torah, Shevuoth, Purim, Orthodox Holy Thursday, Orthodox Good Friday, first two and last two days of Passover, the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha, the day before Lunar New Year, Lunar New Year, the Hindu festival of Diwali on the day that Lakshmi Puja is observed, Three Kings' Day, Tisha B'Av, and all state and national holidays.
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
